main event: A USAF Pilot observed a stationary, large star or planet-like object in Columbus, Ohio on January 7th, 1948 at an altitude of 3000'.
interesting points: The object was described as having a normal amber color and appeared to move stationarily at a large altitude.
The observation was made by a US Air Force pilot, adding credibility to the report.
The object was observed for an unspecified length of time.
There was one other witness to the event.
The shape of the object was compared to that of a large star or planet.
sighted object: stationary large star or planet-like object
